unit_learning_outcomes.description: Recognise the importance of core skills in healthcare and research
Analyse the role of leadership and followership in teamwork.
Apply the fundamental skills required for personal reflection and life-long learning.
Define the key attributes of effective teams.
Select and integrate evidence from reliable academic sources

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Online resources available via iLearn website that support student learning.
Ongoing weekly study to consolidate learning and prepare for each scheduled class.
Recommended readings that support student learning.

assessments.description: A short reflective writing task, focussed on the initial few weeks of course content.
A short written analysis of a video recorded interaction.

assessments.assessment_title: Discussion forum and online task participation
assessments.description: Participation in this unit will attract 10% of the units’ total marks. Participation will be marked based upon completion of activities on this units iLearn page. Examples of activities are forum posts and quizzes.
A group project comprising a video presentation and an annotated bibliography of sources used in the presentation.
A reflective writing task demonstrating progress against an aspect of the capability statements in the portfolio

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: MEDI1400 - Foundations of Learning,  Communication and Teamwork

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is the first of a series of key units within the Bachelor of Clinical Science that focus on the core knowledge and skills underpinning a career in health care as a researcher, manager, or practitioner. Starting with core concepts in professional conduct and university learning, you will explore professionalism through a variety of topics, including: reflection, evidence, communication, and teamwork. Learning activities will include interactive tutorials, online activities, and expert lectures allowing you to develop your understanding of professional practice and build your capacity to become a reflective learner in the health context.
data.search_title: MEDI1400 - Foundations of Learning,  Communication and Teamwork
